channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 Takeaways From the Seahawks' Win Over the Commanders
item.description: The Seahawks made a statement on Sunday night with their win over the Commanders. Here's what we learned.

item.title: Commanders QB Jayden Daniels Exits in Air Cast With Arm Injury vs. Seahawks
item.description: Jayden Daniels exited the Commanders' matchup against the Seahawks on Sunday Night Football after a devastating injury to his non-throwing arm.

item.title: Denny Hamlin 'In Shock' after Elusive Cup Title Slips through Fingertips
item.description: It was heartbreak for Denny Hamlin at Phoenix, and at the moment, he never wants to race a car ever again.

item.title: MLB Gold Glove Awards: Cubs Get Major League-High Three Winners
item.description: The Chicago Cubs had a major league-high three Gold Glove winners for the 2025 season.

item.title: 4 Takeaways From Cup Finale: Kyle Larson's Triumph, Denny Hamlin's Letdown
item.description: Kyle Larson won the 2025 NASCAR Cup Series title without leading a lap Sunday at Phoenix Raceway. Here's how it all shook out.

item.title: Daniels hurt late, exits with left arm in air cast
item.description: Jayden Daniels left Washington's game Sunday night after his left arm bent gruesomely while being tackled.

item.title: Little drills record 68-yard FG, sparking Jags in win
item.description: Jacksonville Jaguars kicker Cam Little hit an NFL-record 68-yard field goal as time expired in the first half against the Las Vegas Raiders at Allegia...

item.title: Why is Mike McDaniel still in Miami? Answering key questions about Dolphins' shakeup
item.description: Answering the key questions following the Dolphins' decision to part ways with Chris Grier and keep Mike McDaniel.

item.title: Kyle Larson wins NASCAR championship, denies Denny Hamlin
item.description: Kyle Larson denied Denny Hamlin his first career championship when a late caution at Phoenix Raceway sent title-deciding finale into overtime.

item.title: Bears thrilled, Bengals 'sick' after wild shootout
item.description: After the Bengals scored two touchdowns in a 49-second span to erase Chicago's 14-point lead, the Bears pulled off their fifth win of the season when ...
